title: Modern JavaScript Essentials
description: A deep dive into ES6+ features like Promises, Async/Await, and modern module systems, designed to make you a highly efficient JavaScript developer.
short_description: Master asynchronous JavaScript and ES6 features.

lessons.title: Setting Up Your Development Environment
lessons.text_content: In this lesson, you will learn how to properly set up a JavaScript development environment. We cover installing VS Code, choosing extensions, configuring Node.js, and understanding how to run JavaScript files using the terminal.

lessons.title: Understanding Arrow Functions and 'this'
lessons.text_content: Arrow functions offer a concise syntax and a lexical 'this' binding. This lesson explores how arrow functions differ from traditional functions and how they help avoid issues with 'this' in callbacks.

lessons.title: Asynchronous JavaScript: Promises & Fetch
lessons.text_content: Learn how Promises work, how to chain .then() calls, handle errors using .catch(), and make API calls using the Fetch API. This lesson teaches the core of modern asynchronous JavaScript.

lessons.title: Async/Await Deep Dive
lessons.text_content: Async/Await makes asynchronous code easier to read. In this lesson, you will learn how to convert promise chains into clean async functions and handle API errors using try/catch.

lessons.title: Modules & Import/Export
lessons.text_content: Discover how JavaScript modules work. Learn how to structure code across multiple files using export and import statements, making your code more reusable and maintainable.

quiz.text: Which keyword is used to declare a variable with block scope that cannot be reassigned?
What does a Promise resolve into when successful?
Which method is used to handle errors in Promises?
Async/Await is syntactic sugar for what?
Which statement allows you to export a function in ES modules?

title: Advanced CSS Layouts (Flexbox & Grid)
description: Master modern responsive design techniques using CSS Grid and Flexbox for complex, real-world layouts.

lessons.title: Introduction to Flexbox Containers
lessons.text_content: This lesson introduces Flexbox, a layout model that helps align items efficiently. You will learn about flex containers, flex items, and how to activate flex behavior using display:flex.

lessons.title: Flexbox Alignment & Ordering
lessons.text_content: Learn how to align elements along the main and cross axis using justify-content and align-items. This lesson also covers ordering items and controlling their direction with flex-direction.

lessons.title: CSS Grid: Full Guide
lessons.text_content: CSS Grid is a powerful two-dimensional layout system. You will learn about grid-template-columns, rows, gap, fr units, and how to build professional responsive grid structures.

lessons.title: Responsive Layouts with Grid + Flexbox
lessons.text_content: This lesson shows how Flexbox and Grid can work together to create fully responsive layouts. You will use media queries to adapt page structure for different screen sizes.

quiz.text: Which CSS property is primarily used to align items along the main axis in Flexbox?
Which unit is commonly used in CSS Grid to represent a flexible fraction of space?
Which property enables a container to use Flexbox?
Which property defines rows in CSS Grid?
Which of the following helps make layouts responsive?

title: React Fundamentals & Hooks Mastery
description: Learn the fundamentals of React including components, props, state, and essential hooks like useEffect and useState.

lessons.title: React Components & JSX
lessons.text_content: This lesson explains JSX syntax and how components work in React. You will learn how functional components return UI and how JSX compiles to JavaScript.

lessons.title: State & Props Explained
lessons.text_content: Understand how props are used for data passing and how state handles component-level data. You will see real examples of interactive UI updates.

lessons.title: Understanding useState & useEffect
lessons.text_content: Learn the most essential hooksâ€”useState for state updates and useEffect for running side effects such as API calls or event listeners.

lessons.title: React Router Basics
lessons.text_content: React Router helps build multi-page experiences. This lesson covers routing, navigation, and dynamic URL parameters.

lessons.title: Context API & useReducer
lessons.text_content: Learn global state management using Context API and useReducer. You will explore actions, dispatch, and reducers to manage complex state.

quiz.text: Which hook is used to handle side effects in React?
React components must return:
Which hook updates component state?
Which library is commonly used for routing in React?
The Context API is mainly used to:

title: Complete HTML5 Masterclass
description: Learn HTML5 from the ground up including semantic tags, forms, media embedding, and structuring professional webpages.
short_description: Build clean and semantic webpage structures.

lessons.title: HTML Document Structure
lessons.text_content: Learn the basic structure of an HTML document including doctype, html, head, and body. This lesson builds the foundation for all future HTML topics.

lessons.title: Semantic HTML Tags
lessons.text_content: Semantic tags describe meaning, not appearance. You will learn header, nav, section, article, footer, and why semantic HTML improves SEO and accessibility.

lessons.title: HTML Forms & Validations
lessons.text_content: This lesson teaches how to build forms using input, textarea, select, and built-in HTML validation attributes such as required and minlength.

lessons.title: Embedding Images, Videos & Audio
lessons.text_content: Learn how to embed media files using img, video, and audio tags. You will also explore attributes like controls, autoplay, and responsive image techniques.

quiz.text: Which HTML tag represents independent self-contained content?
Which tag is used to embed an image?
Which attribute makes a form input required?
Which tag is semantic?
Which element contains metadata in HTML?

title: Node.js & Express Crash Course
description: Learn backend development using Node.js, Express routing, API creation, and working with middleware and JSON data.
short_description: Build APIs with Node.js and Express.

lessons.title: Setting Up Node.js Environment
lessons.text_content: Start by installing Node.js and learning how the runtime works. This lesson covers npm, package.json, and how to run JavaScript files in a server environment.

lessons.title: Express Routing Basics
lessons.text_content: Learn how Express handles routing using app.get(), app.post(), and route parameters. This lesson helps you build multipage APIs with ease.

lessons.title: Middleware Explained
lessons.text_content: Middleware functions run before route handlers. You will learn built-in middleware, custom middleware, next(), and its role in authentication and logging.

lessons.title: Building REST APIs
lessons.text_content: This lesson teaches CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) using Express and JSON data. You will build your first REST API step by step.

quiz.text: Which method is used to define a GET route in Express?
Which file defines dependencies in Node.js?
Middleware functions have access to which argument?
Which command initializes a Node project?
Express is built on top of which platform?

title: Python for Beginners
description: Start coding with Python by understanding variables, loops, functions, and real project applications.

lessons.title: Variables & Data Types
lessons.text_content: Learn how Python stores data using variables and the different data types like int, float, string, and boolean. This is your first step into Python programming.

lessons.title: Loops & Conditions
lessons.text_content: Understand how while and for loops work and how conditions using if, elif, and else help control program flow depending on logic.

lessons.title: Functions & Parameters
lessons.text_content: Learn how to define functions using 'def', pass parameters, return values, and reuse code efficiently in your Python programs.

lessons.title: Working with Lists & Dictionaries
lessons.text_content: Lists and dictionaries are powerful data structures. In this lesson, you will learn how to create, update, loop through, and manipulate them.

quiz.text: Which symbol is used for comments in Python?
Which loop iterates over items of a sequence?
Which keyword defines a function in Python?
What is the output of: type(10)?
Which of these is a valid Python data type?
